result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cameron J Kozak in court. JJ Crawford for the State. Attorney Josh Ryan for defendant. State will be charging. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond w/ NVC correction filed with the court
Signed bond filed with the court.

*CORRECTION 6-28-2022 - Bond amended to correct no contact condition. NO VIOLENT CONTACT with W.J.K. d.o.b. 1-19-1967. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 


Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH W.J.K. dob 1-19-1967. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2865,2866

Defendant Cameron J Kozak in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appears for bond purposes only. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
